alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 9:20PM CST until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River at Moline affecting Rock Island and Henry IL Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Rock Island and Henry IL Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Water affects residences in outlying areas immediately along the river including basements, yards, driveways, and access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CST Wednesday was 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.7 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall early Saturday afternoon. It will rise again to 13.9 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
